wikipedia_page.main: George Minshull Sessford (7 November 1928 - 21 July 1996) was  Bishop of Moray, Ross and Caithness in the second half of the 20th century.

link_mentions.page: Bishop of Moray, Ross and Caithness

response: Nimmo was ordained in the Scottish Episcopal Church (SEC) as a deacon in 1978 and as a priest in 1979 during services at Inverness Cathedral by George Sessford. For his curacy, he served as Precentor of Inverness Cathedral between 1978 and 1981. He then joined St Peter's Church, Stornoway, Isle of Lewis in the Diocese of Argyll and the Isles: he served as priest in charge from 1981 to 1983, and as rector in 1984. He then moved to the Diocese of Edinburgh to become rector of St Michael and All Saints, Edinburgh. He was additionally a chaplain at HM Prison Edinburgh, between 1987 and 1990.
